intro: Distylium guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan distylium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Mexico and Central America, particularly found in the highlands of Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
